content.description: Wishbone is hard for the first couple of bolts and then is followed by easier terrain.  The last clips are surprisingly exposed to a small runout to the anchor.
content.protection:
Four bolts to an anchor.  It has lowering gear and shares anchors with the route to the right,

Uncertainty Principle

. You may need a small amount of new webbing.
content.location:
This is right of

The Razor

and left of

Uncertainty Principle

.

content.description: The name says it all. A hard start from lack of foot holds leads to a sea of thin and frail holds, staying just left of the bolts the whole way to the anchor.  Mentally taxing!
content.protection:
Clip five or six bolts to an anchor with lower gear. It is the main lower anchor for

Wishbone

, Uncertainty Principle, and

This Little Piggy

.
content.location:
This is the left route on the steep face of the Hamm Boulder. It shares the anchor of

Wishbone

.

content.description:
This looks as delicate as its neighbor,

Uncertainty Principle

, yet turns out to be much more solid and therefore less nerve-racking.  A hard start leads to great edges and rails, clipping to the right, to move up this sustained line. It may be the best route on the boulder.
content.protection:
Four bolts to an anchor.  At the moment, there is no convenient lower anchor, but the second could lead from TLP anchor to

UP

anchor.  Then back clean the TLP anchor. It is a little awkward but doable. Other options exist if you brainstorm....
content.location:
It is right of

Uncertainty Principle

.

content.description: Start up a widening finger/hand crack to the first bolt, through a bulge, then climb a fun slab to the anchor. It is probably the second best route on the boulder.
content.protection: Four bolts to an anchor. The second cleans the route, throws the rope down, and then walks off.
content.location:
It is right of

Piglet

, below the tree.

content.description: Climb up past three bolts of mostly slab to an anchor for a toprope.
content.protection:
3 bolts. The second can clean the gear, throw the rope, and walk down the back, or set up a TR for

The Razor

.
content.location: It is the furthest west (left) route on the boulder, above the tree.
